title: ACLU Know Your Rights Guide for LGBTQ Individuals
content: The ACLU provides comprehensive legal guidance for LGBTQ individuals facing discrimination. This resource explains your rights under federal and state laws, including workplace protections under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, and offers step-by-step guidance on how to file complaints with the EEOC. The ACLU also offers direct assistance through their Report LGBTQ and HIV Discrimination Page and can connect you with local affiliates for personalized support.
name: LGBTQ Rights
Refuge Restrooms
title: Refuge Restrooms - Find Safe Restroom Access
content: Refuge Restrooms is a mobile-friendly web application that helps transgender, intersex, and gender non-conforming individuals find safe restroom access. The app allows users to search for and add safe restroom locations based on geographic location, provides directions, and includes user comments and ratings. Available via website or as a mobile application.

name: GeoSure
title: GeoSure - Safety Information for LGBTQ+ Travelers
content: GeoSure provides safety scores for locations worldwide, including specific ratings for LGBTQ+ travelers. The app uses a combination of data sources and user feedback to generate safety scores at the neighborhood level, helping travelers make informed decisions about destinations and accommodations.

name: TravelSafer
title: TravelSafer - Emergency Location Sharing
content: TravelSafer is an emergency app that allows users to share their location with trusted contacts with one tap. The app includes an emergency button that will send alerts with the user's exact location, can be set to automatically trigger alerts if check-ins are missed, and works in over 200 countries.

name: Solace
title: Solace - Transgender Resource Navigation App
content: Solace is an app designed to help transgender individuals navigate their transitions, including information about documentation and travel. The app provides personalized, step-by-step guidance for document updates, connects users with local resources, and offers information about ID and travel document requirements.

name: OutRight Action International
title: OutRight Action International - Global LGBTIQ Rights
content: OutRight Action International works to advance human rights for LGBTIQ people around the world and provides valuable resources for international travelers. The organization publishes country-specific reports, maintains a global issues tracker, and offers emergency response resources for LGBTIQ individuals facing persecution or emergencies while traveling.

name: GLMA Provider Directory
title: GLMA - Healthcare Provider Directory
content: The GLMA Provider Directory helps travelers locate LGBTQ+ affirming healthcare providers across the United States. The searchable database includes providers who have committed to creating welcoming environments for LGBTQ+ patients, with filters for specialty, location, and insurance acceptance.

name: TSA PreCheck
title: TSA PreCheck for Smoother Security Screening
content: TSA PreCheck allows eligible travelers to experience expedited security screening at participating U.S. airports. Transgender travelers enrolled in PreCheck may experience less intrusive screening, shorter wait times, and fewer potential complications during the security process. The service requires application, background check, and fee.

name: Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP)
title: Smart Traveler Enrollment Program (STEP)
content: STEP is a free service allowing U.S. citizens traveling or living abroad to register their trip with the nearest U.S. Embassy or Consulate. Benefits include receiving important information about safety conditions, contact information for the nearest U.S. embassy or consulate, and assistance during emergencies such as natural disasters or civil unrest.

name: Equaldex - Global LGBTQ Rights Index
title: LGBT Rights by Country & Travel Guide | Equaldex
content: Equaldex provides a comprehensive, up-to-date index of LGBTQ+ rights across different countries, essential for transgender travelers planning international trips. The platform offers detailed information about legal protections, recognition of gender identity, healthcare access, anti-discrimination laws, and overall safety ratings for destinations worldwide. The interactive map and country-specific pages help travelers make informed decisions about where it's safe to travel and what legal challenges they might face in different regions.

name: ILGA World - International LGBTI Association
title: ILGA World is The International Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Trans, and Intersex Association
content: ILGA World provides crucial information for transgender travelers regarding global LGBTQI+ rights and protections across different countries. Their resources include country-specific legal information, safety assessments, and up-to-date reports on laws affecting transgender individuals internationally. The organization maintains a comprehensive database documenting legal recognition of gender identity, anti-discrimination protections, and areas where transgender travelers may face increased risks. This information enables transgender travelers to make informed decisions about international destinations and prepare appropriately for potential challenges they may encounter abroad.

name: Transgender Law Center Resources
title: Legal Resources for Transgender Individuals Facing Discrimination
content: The Transgender Law Center provides essential legal resources for transgender travelers, including guides on law enforcement interactions, ID document updates, and immigrant rights. Their comprehensive resources cover topics such as: 1) Strategies for enforcing your rights during police interactions, 2) Navigation of the complex processes for updating name and gender markers on identification documents, 3) Reporting law enforcement abuse and discrimination, 4) Know Your Rights information for transgender and gender non-conforming immigrants, and 5) Legal tools to address various forms of discrimination and harassment. These resources are particularly valuable for transgender travelers who may encounter legal challenges while traveling.

name: ACLU LGBTQ Rights
title: ACLU Legal Guide: Workplace and Public Discrimination Protections
content: The ACLU provides critical information about the evolving legal landscape for LGBTQ people in the United States. This resource explains workplace discrimination protections under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, which some courts have ruled extends to sexual orientation and gender identity discrimination. It details the process for filing complaints with the EEOC, gathering documentation of discrimination, and connecting with local ACLU affiliates for personalized legal support. This information is valuable for transgender travelers who may need to understand their legal protections while traveling within different U.S. jurisdictions.

name: National Center for Transgender Equality - Airport Rights
title: Airport Security and Travel Rights Guide for Transgender Travelers
content: The National Center for Transgender Equality provides a detailed guide for transgender travelers navigating airport security. It covers ID requirements, security screening procedures, medical equipment considerations, and strategies for addressing potential issues. The guide emphasizes travelers' rights and offers contact information for reporting discrimination.

name: USA.gov Passport Information
title: USA.gov Official Guide to Passport Applications, Renewals and Replacement
content: This official USA.gov resource provides comprehensive guidance on U.S. passport services, including applications for new passports, renewals, and replacements for lost or stolen documents. The guide covers specific requirements for adult passports, minor passports, and special circumstances. It explains both in-person and mail application processes, how to check application status, and what to do if your passport is lost while traveling internationally. This information is essential for transgender travelers planning international trips and needing to understand current passport requirements.

name: TSA Transgender Passenger Information
title: TSA Official Guidance for Transgender Passengers During Security Screening
content: The Transportation Security Administration (TSA) provides guidance for transgender passengers navigating airport security. The resource outlines AIT screening procedures, ID verification processes, and options for private screening. It also explains how to contact TSA Cares for additional assistance before traveling and emphasizes that all travelers must be screened regardless of gender identity.

name: State Department LGBTQI+ Travel Information
title: International Travel
content: The U.S. Department of State provides important travel guidance specifically for LGBTQI+ travelers. This resource includes country-specific information about laws that might affect LGBTQI+ visitors, safety considerations, and tips for navigating international travel safely. The information covers topics such as legal recognition of same-sex relationships, laws regarding gender expression, and areas where LGBTQI+ travelers may face increased scrutiny or discrimination. This is an essential resource for transgender travelers planning international trips.

title: Identity Document Guide Under 2025 Policy Changes
content:
Identity Documents for Trans, Nonbinary, Gender-Nonconforming, and Intersex PeopleNote: This page will be routinely updated with new information as we learn and can confirm it. Last updated February 26, 2025.

Transgender, gender-nonconforming, nonbinary, and intersex people (TGNCNBI) might be wondering what they should know about various identity documents following the sex and gender executive order issued by Trump on January 20, 2025. As various federal agencies take steps to implement the discriminatory Executive Order, we have compiled this resource to share basic information, review things you may want to consider moving forward, and offer additional resources available to help the TGNCNBI community.
 Keep in mind that this is not legal advice. So, if you can, it is strongly recommended to get legal advice about your situation from an attorney licensed to practice in your state. 

U.S. Passports and Consular Reports of Birth Abroad (CRBA)
Things to know. 
The Trump administration has changed the available gender marker options for U.S. passports and CRBAs. Among other actions, the Executive Order instructed the Secretary of State to implement changes that would effectively deny accurate passports to transgender, gender-nonconforming, nonbinary, and intersex people. On January 23, Secretary of State Marco Rubio told the State Department employees that applications requesting X gender markers and applications requesting gender marker changes (from F to M or M to F) should
name: Identity Documents for Trans, Nonbinary, Gender-Nonconforming, and Intersex People

title: Travel Advisory: Critical Information for Nonbinary and Trans New Jersey Residents
content: Garden State Equality, New Jersey's largest LGBTQ+ advocacy organization, has issued an important travel advisory for nonbinary and transgender New Jersey residents. The advisory warns travelers to exercise caution when traveling internationally and notes heightened risks when reentering the United States, particularly for those using passports with X gender markers. The advisory explains that while X-marker passports issued before recent policy changes remain valid, their status is uncertain as Secretary of State Marco Rubio has indicated that further guidance is forthcoming. Garden State Equality commits to providing ongoing updates and continues to offer name and gender marker change assistance to community members.
name: RELEASE: Travel Advisory for Nonbinary and Trans New Jersey Residents

title: U.S. Passports
content: The U.S. State Department provides official information on gender marker options for U.S. passports. This resource details the requirements and procedures for updating gender markers on passports, which is critical information for transgender travelers. Due to recent policy changes in 2025, the page now explains the current restrictions on gender marker options and provides guidance for transgender individuals navigating the passport application or renewal process under the new regulations.
name: U.S. Passports Gender Marker Information
